strapiPost.title: California Bike Manufacturer Signs Lease With Ledger
strapiPost.content:
A high-end bike manufacturer has signed a lease with Ledger in Bentonville to occupy approximately 4,200 square feet on the first floor of the six-story building downtown.

  • Local presence: Specialized Bicycle Components has centers in Colorado and California, and the Bentonville location will open in the fall with Ledger, soon-to-be the world’s first bikeable building. 
  • First floor: The new Specialized space has been designed to be an “Experience Center” and a “communal hub” before and after time on the trails with areas to take a post-ride shower and enjoy a coffee. Specialized is the second business after Mertins Eye & Optical to announce a lease agreement with Ledger. 

Read the Talk Business & Politics story HERE.
